parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. The post explicitly mentions Mircea Geoană and states that he supports the Partidul România în Acțiune. While Mircea Geoană himself is not running for parliament in this election, the post clearly links him to a political party participating in the parliamentary elections. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and includes hashtags targeting a wide geographical area (#Mehedinți #DrobetaTurnuSeverin #Orșova #BaiadeAramă). This indicates an intention to reach a broad audience, fulfilling "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>True. The explicit endorsement of Partidul România în Acțiune by a prominent figure like Mircea Geoană is clearly intended to influence voters.  The objective is to garner support for the party in the parliamentary elections. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>False. The post lacks journalistic objectivity. It's a clear expression of support for a specific political party, not an attempt to provide neutral information or analysis.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. While it might be argued that this is Geoană's personal opinion, the context of a paid Facebook advertisement, targeting a wide audience during an election campaign, transforms this personal opinion into a form of electoral propaganda.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1244915983757890</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post, a paid Facebook advertisement by Partidul România în Acțiune, features Mircea Geoană endorsing the party.  While Geoană isn't a candidate, his endorsement clearly aims to influence voters in favor of the party during the parliamentary elections. The post's wide reach and explicit support for a participating party strongly suggest it's electoral propaganda.  The fact that it's a paid advertisement further strengthens this conclusion.  The absence of a CMF number is not a decisive factor, as the post still clearly fulfills the criteria for electoral propaganda.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Mircea Geoană</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Partidul România în Acțiune</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>PRA</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Partidul România în Acțiune, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei reclame plătite pe Facebook (ID postare: 1244915983757890), după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care îl prezintă pe Mircea Geoană susținând Partidul România în Acțiune, având un efect electoral clar de influențare a votului în favoarea partidului respectiv.  Reclama, cu o cheltuială de 1000-1500 RON, a atins 45.000-50.000 de impresii, vizând o audiență largă din județul Mehedinți.  Conținutul postării, lipsit de obiectivitate jurnalistică și având ca scop explicit promovarea unui partid participant la alegerile parlamentare, constituie propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea perioadei legale de campanie.  Datele de contact ale Partidului România în Acțiune sunt disponibile la adresa https://partidulromaniainactiunemehedinti.info/.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
